result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

2:00 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant Joshua D Boileau appeared by Zoom, in custody from Winnebago County Jail.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Joshua D Boileau. Attorney appears as friend of the court. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Nimmer will be appointed. 
Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived. 
THE DEFENDANT SHOULD BE RELEASED BY THE TIME OF THE NEXT COURT DATE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 10:15 am.
